intro: Hibbertia lepidophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Hibbertia lepidophylla is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. It plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for native pollinators.
